title: Take-home_Exercise 1
text:
pacman::p_load(tidyverse,haven)
stu_qqq <- read_sas("data/cy08msp_stu_qqq.sas7bdat")

stu_qqq_SG <- stu_qqq %>%
  filter(CNT == "SGP")

write_rds(stu_qqq_SG,
          "data/stu_qqq_SG.rds")

stu_qqq_SG <- 
  read_rds("data/stu_qqq_SG.rds")


pacman::p_load(ggrepel,
               patchwork,
               ggthemes,
               hrbrthemes,
               tidyverse)


ggplot(data = stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(PV1MPIN))+
  geom_histogram()+
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")

`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.





begin
compute the average

library(dplyr)


stu_qqq_SG <- stu_qqq_SG %>%
  rowwise() %>%
  mutate(READING_ave = mean(c_across(PV1READ:PV10READ), na.rm = TRUE))
print(stu_qqq_SG)

#   Option_ICTQ <dbl>, Option_WBQ <dbl>, Option_PQ <dbl>, Option_TQ <dbl>,

#   ST250Q03JA <dbl>, ST250Q04JA <dbl>, ST250Q05JA <dbl>, ST250D06JA <chr>, …



stu_qqq_SG <- stu_qqq_SG %>%
  rowwise() %>%
  mutate(SCIENCE_ave = mean(c_across(PV1SCIE:PV10SCIE), na.rm = TRUE))
print(stu_qqq_SG)

# A tibble: 6,606 × 1,281
# Rowwise: 
   CNT   CNTRYID CNTSCHID CNTSTUID CYC   NatCen STRATUM SUBNATIO REGION  OECD

stu_qqq_SG <- stu_qqq_SG %>%
  rowwise() %>%
  mutate(MATH_ave = mean(c_across(PV1MCUD:PV10MCUD), na.rm = TRUE))
print(stu_qqq_SG)

pacman::p_load(ggrepel, patchwork, 
               ggthemes, hrbrthemes,
               tidyverse) 


p1<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(READING_ave))+
  geom_histogram()+
  ggtitle("Distribution of Reading_PV")+
  theme_economist()
print(p1)

`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.






p2<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(MATH_ave))+
  geom_histogram()+
  ggtitle("Distribution of Math_PV")+
  theme_economist()
print(p2)

`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.






p3<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(SCIENCE_ave))+
  geom_histogram()+
  ggtitle("Distribution of Science_PV")+
  theme_economist()
print(p3)

`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.






p1 / p2 / p3

`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.





2.

stu_qqq_SG <- stu_qqq_SG %>%
  mutate(GENDER = case_when(
    ST004D01T == 1 ~ "female",
    ST004D01T == 2 ~ "male"
  ))


p4<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(READING_ave,
           GENDER
           ))+
  geom_boxplot(notch=TRUE)


p5<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(MATH_ave,
           GENDER
           ))+
  geom_boxplot(notch=TRUE)


p6<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(SCIENCE_ave,
           GENDER
           ))+
  geom_boxplot(notch=TRUE)


p4/p5/p6




3.


p7<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(x=CNTSCHID,
           y=MATH_ave)) +
  geom_point()
print(p7)





p8<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(x=CNTSCHID,
           y=READING_ave)) +
  geom_point()
print(p8)





p9<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(x=CNTSCHID,
           y=SCIENCE_ave)) +
  geom_point()
print(p9)





p7 / p8 /p9




4.

stu_qqq_SG <- stu_qqq_SG %>%
  mutate(FOOD = case_when(
    ST258Q01JA == 1 ~ "almost never",
    ST258Q01JA == 2 ~ "once a week",
    ST258Q01JA == 3 ~ "2or3 times a week",
    ST258Q01JA == 4 ~ "4or5 times a week",
    ST258Q01JA == 5 ~ "alomst everday"
  ))


p10<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(FOOD,
           MATH_ave))+
  geom_point()
print(p10)





p11<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(FOOD,
           SCIENCE_ave))+
  geom_point()
print(p11)





p12<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(FOOD,
           READING_ave))+
  geom_point()
print(p12)





p10 / p11 / p12




5.

stu_qqq_SG <- stu_qqq_SG %>%
  mutate(father_edu = case_when(
    ST007Q01JA == 1 ~ "3.4",
    ST007Q01JA == 2 ~ "3.3",
    ST007Q01JA == 3 ~ "2",
    ST007Q01JA == 4 ~ "1",
    ST007Q01JA == 5 ~ "Not complete level 1"
  ))


p13<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(father_edu,
           MATH_ave))+
  geom_point()
print(p13)





p14<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(father_edu,
           READING_ave))+
  geom_point()
print(p14)





p15<-ggplot(data=stu_qqq_SG,
       aes(father_edu,
           SCIENCE_ave))+
  geom_point()
print(p15)
